articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Senegalese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Senegalese President
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Abdoulaye Wade, president of Senegal, on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields. He sincerely wished the President greater success in his work for consolidating peace, stability and national unity of the country and social progress and economical development.

articles.title: Lao Vice-president on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Lao Vice-president on Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Boungnang Vonachit, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party who is vice-president of Laos, on March 31 met and had a conversation with the military delegation of the Korean People's Army led by Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, on a visit to his country at the building of the presidency. 
					 He said that the friendly relations between Laos and the DPRK were provided and developed by Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He stressed that KPA has reliably defended the country and the revolutionary gains.
					
					 Douangchai Phichith, vice-prime minister and minister of Defence of Laos, also met and had a conversation with the delegation on the same day. 
					
					 He noted that the Lao party and army have fully supported the army and people of the DPRK in the efforts to build a thriving nation while firmly protecting the socialist cause.
					
					 He stressed that the Lao army would boost exchange and cooperation with KPA.

articles.title: Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The members of the delegation of the Organizing Committee for the 2011 Women's World Cup led by Theo Zwanziger, president of the German Football Association, visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					 The guests made bows before him in humble reverence for him.

articles.title: S. Korea's Move to Stoke Consciousness of Confrontation Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korea's Move to Stoke Consciousness of Confrontation Slammed
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society of south Korea in a commentary on March 29 chided the puppet authorities for their dastardly move to fan up the consciousness of confrontation with the DPRK among children.
					 The commentary referred to the fact that the Ministry of Defence, the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology and the General Federation of Teachers Organizations concluded a MOU for revitalizing the security education on March 25.
					
					 This is aimed to infuse the consciousness of confrontation with compatriots into kindergarteners and pupils through the show of anti-DPRK videos produced by the authorities and visits to units of the army, it held.
					
					 It demanded an immediate stop to the reckless action.

articles.title: Move for Expanding Firing Range of Air Force Rejected in S. Korea
articles.content:
Move for Expanding Firing Range of Air Force Rejected in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The inhabitants in Ryoju County, Kyonggi Province of south Korea came out against the move of the Ministry of Defense to expand a firing range of its air force. 
					 They expressed their strong anger at the ministry keen to expropriate their land for expanding the firing range in the county. 
					
					 They expressed their will to form an all-people county committee for checking the expansion of the above-said firing range with chiefs of ris and members of civic and public organizations of various circles in the county on April 6 and to stage an action to force the ministry to retract the plan for the expansion and close the firing range.

articles.title: Puppet Military Authorities' Humiliating Action Flayed
articles.content:
Puppet Military Authorities' Humiliating Action Flayed
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea at the 110th rally for peace and disarmament in Seoul on March 29 denounced the puppet military authorities for kowtowing to the U.S.
					 A resolution read out at the rally accused the Ministry of Defence of deciding to introduce U.S.-made F-35 fighters earlier than scheduled.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 This issue had already been put on hold for budget waste and personal security and for other reasons but the deal was clinched at an early time unexpectedly. This was due to the U.S. pressure and humiliating attitude of Chongwadae towards it.
					
					 The resolution expressed irrepressible indignation at the reckless decision of the authorities to spend the money collected from the people as taxes for the introduction of rejected product F-35, demanding a prompt retraction of the decision.

articles.title: Abolition of Evil Law Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abolition of Evil Law Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- South Korean lawyers held a symposium at Sogang University on March 28 to expose the draconic nature of the "law on assembly and demonstration".
					 Speakers deplored that it has become a common practice to brand even a press conference or one-man demonstration as illegal and holding a poster or shouting a slogan, in particular, is liable to suppression after the emergence of the present regime. 
					
					 Recalling that the above-said law calls for submitting a notice to the chief of a police station in any area 48 hours before the holding of any assembly and demo and stipulates that anyone violating this or sponsoring any assembly or demonstration without getting the permission of the police is punishable by law, they declared that this provision amounts to a violation of even elementary right of the people. 
					
					 They branded the law as an evil law as it allows the police to check any plan for assembly and demonstration in advance under the pretext of "ensuring security" and intensify the control over civic and public organizations. 
					
					 The law should be repealed at once to ensure the freedom of assembly and demonstration, they urged.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Cambodian and Russian papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The March 25 issue of the Cambodian paper Kmae Amata carried an article titled "Eternal President of the DPRK" with a portrait of smiling President and photos on his revolutionary activities.
					
					 The paper in the article noted that the President put forward the original line of setting up the people's government and established the people's revolutionary government in guerrilla bases during the days of the anti-Japanese war. It also recalled that the President clarified the character and duty of the Korean revolution and laid down an original line of founding a state in conformity with the desire of the Korean people and founded the DPRK after the liberation of the country.
					
					 The 12th issue of the Russian paper Patriot edited articles with a portrait of the President and a photo showing the President standing together with Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper in articles pointed to the facts that the President provided the people with all good social and political conditions so that they might exercise their right as the master of the country and Kim Jong Il has conducted energetic activities to carry forward and realize the idea and the cause of the President.
					
					 The paper referred to the facts that the President regarded the slogan "Mix with the people!" as his motto all his life and embodied the politics of love and trust in the people, the first of its kind in human history.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- A meeting and film show took place in Romania, round table talks in China and the opening ceremony of a DPRK book, photo and handcraft exhibition and a photo exhibition in Russia between March 25 and 28 on the occasions of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army.
					 Displayed in the venues were works of the President and Kim Jong Il, photos on their revolutionary exploits and handcrafts showing the creative wisdom of the Korean people.
					
					 The participants in the film show watched the Korean film "Reply of Korea".
					
					 The chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union said that the President founded the Juche idea, liberated the country from the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists, led the building of a new society, the Fatherland Liberation War and socialist construction to victories and built the socialist system centered on the popular masses in Korea. 
					
					 The vice mayor of Artyom City of Russia said that the DPRK book, photo and handcraft exhibition would mark an important occasion in infusing the internationalism into citizens and young people. 
					
					 The deputy chairman of the Artyom City Assembly said that the Songun politics enforced by Kim Jong Il serves as a driving force and source of all victories that enable the Korean people to dynamically advance towards socialism despite the fast-changing political situation in the world. 
					
					  A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the round table talks in China.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Cause Supported in Russia
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Supported in Russia 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Saratov Regional Committee of the Communist Workers' Party of Russia-Revolutionary Communist Party issued an appeal on March 24 in support of the just cause of the Korean people.
					 The appeal expressed full support for the line of the Workers' Party and the government of Korea to vigorously wage a general offensive to bring about a decisive turn in improving the standard of people's living and building a thriving nation this year and achieve the country's peaceful reunification free from any foreign interference. 
					
					 The appeal expressed bitter resentment at the U.S. instigating the south Korean authorities to push the inter-Korean relations to collapse.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Korean People's Army fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique and loyal to its people as it holds Kim Jong Il as its supreme commander will deal irrevocable blows at the aggressors.
					
					 It called upon the progressive political parties and public organizations of Russia to extend positive support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Election as NDC Chairman Celebrated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Election as NDC Chairman Celebrated
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea issued the 20th issue of its bulletin titled "Strength of Korea" on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 The bulletin noted in an article that the DPRK, though not a big country, has such tremendous strength that even the U.S. dares not match though it styles itself "the world's only superpower."
					
					 The military capability of the DPRK has grown stronger as it holds Kim Jong Il as Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army and Chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, it noted.
					
					 It said that the Juche idea, the Songun idea founded by the President and developed by Kim Jong Il has become the only guiding idea of the DPRK.

articles.title: Damage by Radiation, Quake and Tsunami Increases
articles.content:
Damage by Radiation, Quake and Tsunami Increases
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Damage by radiation caused by the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant is getting more serious. 
					Tokyo Electric Power Co. said on Mar. 31 that radioactive iodine nearly 10,000 times the legal threshold was detected in the groundwater near the turbine building of Reactor No. 1 of the plant.
					
					 TEPCO said it was very high level and there was the possibility of rain mixed with radioactive substances in the air falling under ground. 
					
					Radioactive iodine 4,385 times the maximum level permitted under law were detected in a seawater sample collected Wednesday afternoon near the plant.
					
					 Radiation-contaminated vegetables and milk were found in Fukushima Prefecture and it was confirmed that beef in the Prefecture contained a radioactive material exceeding the legal limit. 
					
					A large amount of radioactive materials were detected on more than 1,000 dead bodies in the northeastern coastal areas of Japan to lay a hurdle in the rescue work.
					
					 Radioactive substances that leaked from Japan continue spreading to different countries and regions. 
					
					 Radioactive materials were detected in 15 states of the U.S. Radioactive iodine was recently detected in milk produced in Washington and California States, increasing the public worry and uneasiness. 
					
					 Xinhua News of China reported that a very tiny amount of radioactive materials was found in 25 provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities including Beijing and Tianjin as of Mar. 31. 
					
					 Meanwhile, damage caused by the earthquake and ensuing tsunami is on the steady increase. 
					
					The National Police Agency of Japan said the death toll increased to 11,620 and that of unaccounted for to 16 464 as of 15:00 Friday.
					
					 According to a survey by the Agency of Land and Geography, more than 30 percent of urban areas in 13 cities, chos and sons of Iwate and Miyagi prefectures were submerged owing to the killer quake and ensuing tsunami. 
					
					 Hardest hit is Miyagi Prefecture. It was reported that 50 percent of the whole area of an autonomous region including farmland remains inundated. 
					
					 Aftershocks are going on. 
					
					 Magnitude 5.5 quake occurred in the eastern coastal area of Honshu Island on Friday. Its epicenter was over 20 km deep in the waters off Iwate Prefecture. 
					
					 Magnitude 6.0 quake occurred in the waters off Miyagi Prefecture on Mar. 31.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Fiji
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Fiji 
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 6.4 on the Richter scale jolted Fiji on March 31. 
					 The epicenter was monitored at 16.5 degrees south latitude and 177.5 degrees west longitude.

articles.title: China Accuses Japan of Passing New Textbooks
articles.content:
China Accuses Japan of Passing New Textbooks
 Beijing, April 1 (KCNA) -- Jiang Yu, spokeswoman for the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, at a press conference on March 31 said the ministry lodged a protest with the Japanese side against Japan's screening and passing new textbooks. 
					 Recalling the reports that the Japanese Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology on Mar. 30 announced the results of the screening and passing of new textbooks and textbooks for public schools published by seven publishing houses described Diaoyu islands as part of Japan's territory, she declared that those islands and islets around them have been inherent parts of the territory of China since ancient times and it has indisputable sovereignty over them.

articles.title: China on Story about Its Helicopter's Watch on Japanese Ship
articles.content:
China on Story about Its Helicopter's Watch on Japanese Ship
						
 Beijing, April 1 (KCNA) -- Jiang Yu, spokeswoman for the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, at a press conference on March 31 dismissed Japanese claims that a Chinese helicopter flew too close to a Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force destroyer in the East China Sea.
					 Japan had lodged protests to China noting that a Chinese State Oceanic Administration helicopter watched the destroyer of the Japanese Maritime SDF in the East China Sea by flying close to it.
					
					 The helicopter was conducting regular patrols and maintained the necessary safety distance from the destroyer, the spokeswoman said.
					
					 Clarifying China's consistent and clear stance on the East China Sea, she urged Japan to take a responsible attitude on the relevant issues and stop doing things that might further complicate the situation.

articles.title: Security of Military Nuclear Facilities of China Guaranteed
articles.content:
Security of Military Nuclear Facilities of China Guaranteed
						
 Beijing, April 1 (KCNA) -- China's military nuclear facilities are safe, said a Chinese senior military officer on Thursday in response to security concerns triggered by Japanese nuclear leak crisis.
					 "We have thoroughly examined the military nuclear facilities shortly after the nuclear plant accident in Japan," said Cai Hualie, senior officer with the People's Liberation Army General Staff Headquarters at a press conference. 
					
					 He stressed that the Chinese armed forces have always placed great importance to the safety of military nuclear facilities.
					
					 The Chinese army has worked to strictly implement safety regulations and ensure the safety of missile weaponry and equipment, he added.

articles.title: Defense White Paper Published in China
articles.content:
Defense White Paper Published in China
 Beijing, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Chinese government issued the white paper "China's National Defense in 2010" on March 31.
					 The white paper made it clear that China is steadfastly following the road of peace and planning economic construction and defense building in a uniform manner, pursuant to an independent and sovereign peace-loving diplomatic policy and defense policy, to build a rich country and a powerful army in a uniform way.
					
					 China will not seek hegemony and military expansion in the future, too, it noted.

articles.title: Scientific Development of Military Training Called for in China
articles.content:
Scientific Development of Military Training Called for in China
						
 Beijing, April 1 (KCNA) -- Guo Boxiong, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, underscored the need to promote the scientific development of military training while putting main emphasis on building national defense and army at a meeting of the whole army for deepening the reform in military training held on March 30. 
					 What is important here is to meet the requirements of scientific outlook on development in different fields of military training and improve the overall qualifications of servicepersons and intensify military training in practice with main emphasis on putting it on an IT basis, he stressed. 
					
					 He underlined the need to bring about innovations in military theory and training contents and methods and strictly review them to bolster the combat capabilities of the units.

articles.title: Day of Education in Security for Schoolchildren Observed in China
articles.content:
Day of Education in Security for Schoolchildren Observed in China
						
 Beijing, April 1 (KCNA) -- Activities were conducted in China on March 28 to observe the 16th national day of education in security for primary and middle school students. 
					 Their aim is to help them acquire the common sense of security and cultivate the ability to prevent danger.

articles.title: China Plans Environmental Arrangement in Countryside
articles.content:
China Plans Environmental Arrangement in Countryside
 Beijing, April 1 (KCNA) -- China is planning to make a comprehensive environmental arrangement of 60,000 farm villages till 2015.
					 This plan includes the improvement of quality of water in reservoirs, sewage and garbage treatment, the protection of land, the raising of the farmers' awareness of environmental protection and other work in the countryside.

articles.title: Fidel Castro Condemns West's War Action
articles.content:
Fidel Castro Condemns West's War Action
 Havana, April 1 (KCNA) -- Fidel Castro, leader of the Cuban revolution, in an article titled "Fascist War of NATO" on March 28 condemned the West for its war action.
					 Accusing the war forces having a lot of fighter-bombers, submarines and nuclear aircraft carriers of making brutal air raids on Libya, the article termed this unprecedented fascist war action. 
					
					 The article went on:
					
					 More than 50 years ago, the Cuban people fought against the U.S. threat of brigandish war while shouting the slogan "Motherland or Death." If anyone comes in attack to swallow up Cuba, its people who set store by the tradition of their struggle will serve a strong warning "there will be on this land only blood-soaked dust."

articles.title: US Subversive Acts against Cuba Disclosed
articles.content:
US Subversive Acts against Cuba Disclosed
Havana, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Cuban Television on March 28 showed a documentary exposing the U.S. moves to subvert the Cuban government by using NGOs.
					 The documentary disclosed facts that non-governmental organizations of the U.S. worked hard to erode civil society on the island and gather information while staying in Cuba under the guise of the humanitarian project sponsored by the U.S. Interests Section and Western countries in Havana.
					
					 It also denounced the U.S. for working hard to fabricate a pretext for military intervention in Cuba by wire-pulling NGOs.

articles.title: Russian Inhabitants' Worry about Ecological Environment
articles.content:
Russian Inhabitants' Worry about Ecological Environment
						
 Moscow, April 1 (KCNA) -- The majority of Russians are of the view that the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant in Japan may become the cause of worsening the ecological environment in Russia.
					 66 percent of the respondents expressed the above-said view, according to a recent nationwide poll conducted by the All-Russia Public Poll Center.

articles.title: Pakistan, India Summit Conducive to Bilateral Engagement
articles.content:
Pakistan, India Summit Conducive to Bilateral Engagement
						
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Pakistan and India are making efforts for the improvement of the bilateral relations. 
					 The summit between Pakistani Prime Minister Yusuf Raza Gilani and his Indian counterpart Manmohan Singh on Mar. 31 was a "win-win for the bilateral process of engagement".
					
					 "Pakistan wants to move towards a comprehensive and broad- ranging engagement with India on the basis of equality, mutual trust, mutual interest and mutual respect," said a spokeswoman for the Pakistani Foreign Ministry on the same day.

articles.title: Explosion on US Aircraft Carrier
articles.content:
Explosion on US Aircraft Carrier
 Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- An explosion took place on the U.S. aircraft carrier John Stennis on March 30 when it was moored in the waters off California State. 
					 At the moment a FA-18C Hornet fighter was about to take off, its engine exploded all of a sudden, causing a fire. 
					
					 The explosion left ten seamen wounded and damaged the plane.

articles.title: Census Conducted in Russia
articles.content:
Census Conducted in Russia
 Moscow, April 1 (KCNA) -- The State Statistical Bureau of the Russian Federation, quoting the results of the recent census, said that Russia's present population is the 142.905 million.
					 Its population decreased 1.6 percent from 2002 to 2010.
